intro: Monechma nepeta, commonly known as caraway, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its seeds, often referred to as caraway seeds, are used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant has a distinctive aroma and is valued for its aromatic properties.
